meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a circus.
meanings.sent1: The colorful decorations made the party look circusy.
meanings.sent2: The big top tent and clowns created a circusy atmosphere at the fair.
meanings.sent3: The circusy music playing in the background added a fun touch to the event.
meanings.sent4: Her outfit was so circusy, it seemed like she was part of a traveling show.
meanings.sent5: The circusy smell of popcorn and cotton candy filled the air, bringing back memories of childhood fun.

meanings.definition: Having the qualities or atmosphere of a circus.
meanings.sent1: The bright lights and lively music made the carnival feel circusy.
meanings.sent2: The performers' colorful costumes added to the circusy vibe of the show.
meanings.sent3: The office party had a circusy theme, complete with a clown and acrobatic acts.
meanings.sent4: The chaotic scene at the amusement park was truly circusy, with people rushing in all directions.
meanings.sent5: The old circus posters on the wall gave the room a vintage circusy feel, transporting visitors to a bygone era.
